website_summaries.verdict: Lightweight and versatile, this bag offers travelers many of the best features included in more expensive models.
pros: Made of water-repellent polyester, this 21 in
expandable luggage has 4 heavy-duty spinner wheels and features a rugged aluminum handle
Includes a full-length zippered lid compartment, full bottom tray and side accessory pocket
cons: Best suited for light to moderate use

customer_reviews.title: MEASUREMENTS ARE IN
customer_reviews.text: It took me a million years to sift through the comments and figure out if this carry on was under 22" with the wheels. Someone said that the blue luggage was around 23" which is above the international standard and that only the gray luggage is below 22". Things might have changed since that review. I'm glad to report that this luggage is at 20.25 (with handle) " x 8" with front NOT fully extended) x 13". Awesome spinners too.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick G

customer_reviews.title: Nice Quality and build.  Blue is really darker.
customer_reviews.text: Nice quality. The blue is more darker than shown on Amazon, its more Navy Blue as seen in my photos, not baby blue. Height is 22 inches from the floor to the top of the suitcase. (Travelpro stated 21 inches) It will fit in the overhead cabin locker with no issues (not sure about a turbo prop plane) but it will fit on a jet. Most airlines have 22inch as a max. allowable height. I will attach a photo of the bag in the overhead bin of a JetBlue A320 (a plane with six seats per row with one isle)
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer1

customer_reviews.title: Good size - held 12 days of clothes for a ...
customer_reviews.text: Good size - held 12 days of clothes for a trip abroad. However, it is too heavy for carryon standards if filled to capacity even though it fits in the overhead. Just avoid getting the suitcase weighed and you should be okay as carryon. Spinner style is easier on the go, but this suitcase also can be pulled without a problem. Will report back after 10 trips... but so far so good.
customer_reviews.author: e

customer_reviews.title: Broke the first time I used it!
customer_reviews.text: Before I even left on my first trip with this bag, the zipper broke! I did not over pack it, just a faulty zipper. Bad timing...
customer_reviews.author: Marc Weiner

customer_reviews.title: More than one Maxlite4 Design!
customer_reviews.text: Lightweight, holds way more than I expected, meets International baggage measurement guidelines and looks nice. Beware, however, there.is more than one MaxLite 4 design. I bought a black one from another seller and the wheel base was designed differently. It tipped easily, even when empty. (Look for the design with the wheels that stick out and are more visible rather than the bag with wheels that are partially inset into the base of the bag.)
customer_reviews.author: Justinsmom

customer_reviews.title: Complete waste of money
customer_reviews.text: How unfortunate my return window has closed on this. I used this suitcase only once, and the seam on the outside pocket has unraveled, leaving the contents completely exposed and the outside pocket unusable. Complete waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: The wheels fall apart.
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for a good quality piece of luggage that would last me at least a year or so. I read great things about Travelpro, so I decided to purchase it. It has been 4 months since I've purchased it, and I've taken about 3 trips to Europe. The bag held up well, except for the most important part . . . the wheels. One of the wheels shred apart, to the point where I cannot even use the luggage anymore. Very poor quality wheels. I'll never buy this product again.
customer_reviews.author: Melanie Gerard

customer_reviews.title: Very poor quality!
customer_reviews.text: I used this suitcase one time and the zipper broke on the first leg of the flight. Due to the trip, the 30 day return window has closed on Amazon and now I have a suitcase that I can no longer use. Very poor quality!
customer_reviews.author: Tricia

customer_reviews.title: A mixed bag....
customer_reviews.text: This piece of luggage is light, as advertised, and it is roomy. The problem is a lack of sturdiness. I bought it for a trip to Italy, which I knew would be hard on the luggage, because of all the rough street surfaces. The bag lasted about four hours. The cloth handle broke on the first day--it is held on by two metal rivets, one of which broke. This required me to lift the bag with both hands, for fear of tearing the handle right off the bag. Quite a pain on a two-week trip. When I returned home, I replaced both of the flimsy rivets with a nut and bolt. Not pretty, but much stronger than the inadequate rivets.
customer_reviews.author: Joey G

customer_reviews.title: Wheel showing wear after first trip.
customer_reviews.text: I was very excited about this luggage. I love the color and it is lightweight as promised. I noticed on my return trip after using this bag once that there was some resistance pulling it. After further examination I noticed that one of the wheels is fraying. I am trying to decide if I should return it for a new one. Other than the one wheel I really like this luggage.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent!!
customer_reviews.text: Excellent!!! My husband and I just got two of these for our trip to Italy. We fit 2 weeks of clothes etc. inside. We also walked A LOT with these on cobblestone streets, uneven pavement, etc. the wheels and handle all lasted. (We walked for 20 minutes each way to 2 different train stations. I thought the wheels would for sure break with the extremely rough streets and they never did!!) I would easily purchase these again.
customer_reviews.author: Patricia

customer_reviews.title: Great for business travelers
customer_reviews.text: I travel out of state on business about once a month and this suitcase is a big help. You can fit a lot of stuff in here. In this photo I have 3 suits, 3 dresses, workout clothes, makeup, toiletries, my brief case, a trench coat, boots, 1 pair of heels, and 1 pair of flats. There’s still a lot of space inside for impulse purchases too. It’s easy to maneuver in the airport and doesn’t take up a lot of space in the overhead bin. I highly recommend this for frequent travelers.
customer_reviews.author: KatieTop Contributor: Baby

customer_reviews.title: Suitcase is a nice size, and very light weight
customer_reviews.text: Suitcase is a nice size, and very light weight. It actually weighs less (when empty) than my carry on suitcase. After a 10 day trip and 4 plan trips, it was already showing major signs of wear and the zipper was getting stuck.
customer_reviews.author: Kay

customer_reviews.title: Much smaller than advertised dimensions!
customer_reviews.text: I just received this and noticed it's smaller than expected and not utilizing the allowance for carry ons. See attached images - this Maxlite 4 is not 14 inches wide, it’s 13 inches. This spinner is advertised as 21x14x9, but I currently have one with those dimensions that carries much more, while still fitting in the overhead of small planes. Additionally, it’s advertised as 51 liters of space and it’s substantially less than that. See the calculations below. 21x13x9 = 2457 inches cubed = 40.3 liters (actual volume of the unit) 21x14x9 = 2646 inches cubed = 43.4 liters (volume of mine with those dimensions) Advertising as 51 liters is 10 more liters than the actual space!
customer_reviews.author: Rose

customer_reviews.title: Great international and domestic carry on
customer_reviews.text: Just received this bag. This purchase was primarily to get 4 wheels and to have an extra domestic size carry on that complies with stricter international carry on rules as well. The blue version does measure exactly as described 21"x14"x9" including the wheels, which seems to be fine for any domestic or international airline. The price was great and delivery was prompt with Prime. I hope it lasts as long as its predecessor.
customer_reviews.author: PrimeUser

customer_reviews.title: This bag is great! So easy to move
customer_reviews.text: This bag is great! So easy to move, even when it's full of 50 pounds of stuff. Seriously the rollers are fabulous, rolls without effort. Love it. It is a big bag, but it's a "normal size" big bag.
customer_reviews.author: K. Franzen

customer_reviews.title: Great bag!
customer_reviews.text: Great bag! I travel a lot, often standby, so checking my bag is not convenient. I wanted something that fit in overhead bin that I could also push down the isle. It's very awkward carrying your bag sideways behind or in front of you cause it's too wide to pull down the isle. Plus it trashes my back. This is super light weight and expandable. A good overnight/couple day bag. Love the red. Easy to spot amidst all the 100's of black bags. I wouldn't get colored bags for checking luggage as they get dirty/greasy real fast from the belts and handling.
customer_reviews.author: P. Sean Sullivan

customer_reviews.title: Good quality suitcase
customer_reviews.text: Well built and designed. Only difficulty (and this is present with every "spinner" piece of luggage that I have seen) is that that the spinner wheels are so small that they hang on cracks or changes in a level greater than a couple of inches.
customer_reviews.author: Ely Canter

customer_reviews.title: Overall the material is great condition and interior compartment held up really well and ...
customer_reviews.text: I have used this bag for a year (90+ flights) and found that it held up well but you can anticipate needing to replace it; material on the handle peeled off, back skid plate plucked off, handle is wobbly, on of the wheels is sticking (airports are gross). Overall the material is great condition and interior compartment held up really well and zippers gave no problems.
customer_reviews.author: Mat and Rick

customer_reviews.title: Already ripped
customer_reviews.text: I bought this less than a year ago and already there’s a tear in the fabric. Poor quality and indifferent customer service.
customer_reviews.author: Erica

customer_reviews.title: Good bag, not very expandable
customer_reviews.text: This bag rolls very easily and is a good size to carry on an airplane. I was disappointed in the fact that it expands only a little bit on the bottom end. I know this is so it is still weighted right to keep it from tipping over, but I wish I had bought a bag that expanded more to hold purchases along the way. (I usually check my bag on the return because I expand it.) It seems very sturdy and well-made.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Arrived as scheduled. After examination, I found one ...
customer_reviews.text: Arrived as scheduled. After examination, I found one of the inner clothing pockets was missing its zipper pull tab. I fixed this by looping a key ring thru the hole where the tab should be. It was a quick fix, but still a manufacturing flaw that may irritate future buyers of this product.
customer_reviews.author: Hiroshi

customer_reviews.title: Reduces Travel Stress and Actually, It's Fun
customer_reviews.text: This thing is like 42 stars. It's such a massive upgrade from my old Walmart clunker that it's simply incredible. First, you need a spinner. Everyone does. And this one is just great. Very high quality, nice practical details. Durable, weighted well. It moves beside you as you walk almost by itself. My 1.5 year old daughter pushes it around the hardwood with zero effort. If you find travel stressful, get this or something like it.
customer_reviews.author: Nick777

customer_reviews.title: Somewhat disappointed.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this bag for a trip abroad. This is my first spinner piece of luggage. Pros: Held up well, light weight, able to fit a lot inside. Cons: Does not roll on all four wheels on any kind of carpet (even very low pile), and had to tilt it and roll on two wheels instead. Given the size of the bag, this was very uncomfortable for long distances through airports. Somewhat disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: curlygirl88

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Luggage!
customer_reviews.text: My son and I recently spent a month touring mainland Europe and the UK with these. Weight restrictions on the aircraft now make the light weight of these items very important and kept us within restrictions even considering picking up items as we went along. The cases held up very well throughout the trip and the handle and wheels functioned perfectly. The design maximizes available internal space yet protects everything very well. The side and front compartment were adequate for separating what we desired and were easily accessible even with the back packed. My wife was impressed enough that she subsequently purchased one for her business travel.
customer_reviews.author: Blayne Cannon

customer_reviews.title: handel broke
customer_reviews.text: The first time I used the bag, the handle broke. Can not blame the wight of the bag as there were a laptop, travel pillow, headphones, and charging wires only. The total wight of the bag was less than 10 pounds.
customer_reviews.author: A. D-Pine

customer_reviews.title: Defaulty zipper
customer_reviews.text: I, like multiple other customers, have a faulty zipper. I bought the travel bag eleven months ago, used it twice, did not over pack it or otherwise mishandle it. The cheap plastic zipper simply broke on the second use.
customer_reviews.author: James Marsh

customer_reviews.title: A friend who travels extensively for work recommended this suitcase
customer_reviews.text: A friend who travels extensively for work recommended this suitcase. I shopped around at various stores and saw numerous brands of suitcases, including this one, and compared the quality. Travelpro beats out any competitor in my opinion. Excellent design, light weight, strong fabric body and handle, and excellent wheels. You won't go wrong purchasing this piece of luggage. My friend says it lasts for years.
customer_reviews.author: cjb

customer_reviews.title: Very disappointed in this occurring after 1 flight
customer_reviews.text: After only 1 flight, one of the main zippers was ripped off. I understand that you can have wear and tear with airlines, but I fly every week and the other brand I had never lost a zipper in 10 years. The only reason I bought a new suitcase was because my son left wet swim wear in the larger case and I could not get the sour smell out. Very disappointed in this occurring after 1 flight. they should hold up better than that. My 1st and probably last travelpro purchase if this is the norm.
customer_reviews.author: robin d meier

customer_reviews.title: Zipper Broke before we even left on our vacation
customer_reviews.text: Poorly made. Zipper for extension portion of bag broke before we even left for our vacation (within 2 days of receiving). Overall, the bag seems fine. Nothing special, but a good size. Light. But obviously something you dont want to happen when youre traveling or if you check your bags.
customer_reviews.author: Jacob R

customer_reviews.title: Only lasted 6 months.
customer_reviews.text: Only lasted 3 trips. Took two business trips and a vacation. That's < 10 flights altogether. Wouldn't recommend it. I liked it at first but the zipper broke and found it in a baggage claim missing some of my belongings. I tried fixing it but eventually had to tape it to make it home. *****Update: I was able to get the zipper teeth to lock together. Hopefully it's fine for my next trip.
customer_reviews.author: puchuco

customer_reviews.title: - Easy to maneuver
customer_reviews.text: - Easy to maneuver: lugged it on the bullet train, various subways, and up and down escalators in Japan - Lightweight: fantastic for said above conditions. I had no problems handling my luggage myself. I don't need no man! - Travels well: bought it for express purpose of traveling to Japan from US. It came back on the baggage claim carousel in great condition - Perfect size : forced me to pack smart for our two-week trip while also being able to bring back souvenirs- avoiding overweight baggage fees - Front pockets: great for stuffing in random flat paper items Overall: Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: WideEyedEggplant

customer_reviews.title: Questionable quality, good design otherwise.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this in September 2017. It is now September 2018. I've used it for 5 round trip plane trips, and it is starting to fall apart. I like the way it works. It rolls well. The zippers work well. The design of the pockets works for me - I don't like too may custom designed pockets, I never seem to have the right items for them. I'm just reallydisappointed that it is starting to fall apart. Photo attached showing area where it is coming apart.
customer_reviews.author: Crager

customer_reviews.title: Very happy with purchase
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my husband. He was concerned about it being a little bit smaller than his old suitcase. After a week long trip through four airports and four airplanes he was very surprised that he was able to pack everything inside and it pulled beautifully. No problem in stowing in overhead compartments in most airplanes, except the smaller regional carriers, which have a very small storage capacity. It pulled very smoothly and he is very happy with it. Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Cathy S. Irvin

customer_reviews.title: A tiny bit too small for me
customer_reviews.text: Great build quality, I've had many pieces of luggage before from multiple brands and this one seems to be built way above its price level. My only issue with this was that the capacity for a 21" suitcase was smaller than others I've tried. It's 21" tall but narrow on the width and 'depth' so looks to me more like a larger version of a 19" trolly then a "true" 21" carry on. I would say it can cover 2-3 days trips very nicely, but will struggle for a full 5 days trip.
customer_reviews.author: Gil S

customer_reviews.title: This suitcase is great
customer_reviews.text: We purchased two of these suitcases. This purchase replaced two that were trashed by an airline after returning from Europe. The original two - same brand and model - served us extremely well since 2015 - including 4 2-week trips through Europe, at least 4 cruises, and numerous other travels. They held up well, the color did not fade, don't scratch easily, and packing is easy to do. They are manageable spinners that held up well. While the airline reimbursed us the original purchase cost, we searched for replacements and came back to this brand and style. Even after our search we decided we were satisfied.
customer_reviews.author: ExecJ

customer_reviews.title: I love this bag. Travels light but holds a lot.
customer_reviews.text: I love this bag. I have the carry on smaller version which I loved. I have so many suitcases already but they were a bit heavier. I wanted one that was light but also held a lot, I needed a checked bag for a trip to Europe. I used luggage cubes to keep my clothes organized and had plenty of room to bring back souiveneers and stayed well under the weight requirements. It’s a spinner so easy to transport as well. I recently went to Alaska where I packed boots and heavier clothing. It is expandable. It held my items with no problem. I would recommend the Travelpro line for sure.
customer_reviews.author: Natalie Wilson

customer_reviews.title: Just love it
customer_reviews.text: Haven't traveled with this yet, but after a recent trip - with a bag I came to hate - I caught this very highly rated pair (with the carry-one size) and confirmed the quality with my internationally traveling brother, that this is a good as it gets for weight, strength of body, and ease of use. Loved the color option, and am looking forward to my next trip! the Maxlite set is all expandable with zippers, and overall quality in my inspection is just wonderful. The handle is sturdy and the tilt of the cases themselves makes a big difference in preventing the possible tipping that has happened in other bags. Glad to have caught the pair on Amazon Day.
customer_reviews.author: ljvirgo

customer_reviews.title: Just love it
customer_reviews.text: Haven't traveled with this yet, but after a recent trip - with a bag I came to hate - I caught this very highly rated pair (with the carry-one size) and confirmed the quality with my internationally traveling brother, that this is a good as it gets for weight, strength of body, and ease of use. Loved the color option, and am looking forward to my next trip! the Maxlite set is all expandable with zippers, and overall quality in my inspection is just wonderful. The handle is sturdy and the tilt of the cases themselves makes a big difference in preventing the possible tipping that has happened in other bags. Glad to have caught the pair on Amazon Day.
customer_reviews.author: ljvirgo

customer_reviews.title: Not very big
customer_reviews.text: The actual room you have to pack is much smaller than other suitcase with same dimensions. For example, size 12 shoes will not fit along the sides due to the wheel eat into the sides. This was to replace a samsonite with same dimensions but had much more room...Also and maybe more importantly only buy from a Prime seller, I did not and to return it they want as much as I paid for shipping....live and learn
customer_reviews.author: 2Big Mutts

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: Poor built quality or a lemon unit. The pull-up handle broke and fell off after one (!) trip only! Have a similar 22 inch 2014 model still going strong after weekly use!
customer_reviews.author: Yon V

customer_reviews.title: Very large, lightweight, handles well
customer_reviews.text: This is the largest bag I have ever used and is also light weight.The fabric is tough and durable and the zippers function well. I was fully packed but not stuffed on recent domestic trip. I was right on target at 50 lbs at checkin (whew), so on return trip, I put a pair of sneakers in my husband's bag. Weight of contents was due to cold weather travel, sweaters. packed well but not stuffed, the wheels worked very well with the handled partly raised and either my Bagalinni purse slipped over to ride along, or a fabric tote...and it handled my small, roll-on (fully packed) very sell.
customer_reviews.author: Audrey S

customer_reviews.title: Zipper is Flawed
customer_reviews.text: I was so excited to receive this, as I’m taking my first flight and I needed a piece of luggage that was TSA approved for the overhang. It’s a great lightweight piece of luggage. Very sturdy and the spinners are wonderful. However, as other purchasers have mentioned there is a issue with the zippers. I spent about 20 minutes when I just received it trying to close the large opening with nothing in the suitcase. This is worrisome. I’m afraid it will break. Otherwise the color is beautiful sturdy and light. I hope it handles well for my trip. I don’t have time to return it and purchase another one.
customer_reviews.author: Funneverends

customer_reviews.title: ZIPPER BROKE ON FIRST TRIP
customer_reviews.text: Would give zero if I could!!!!! Zipper on outer pocket separated the first trip I took with the suitcase. There were only flat Vionic sandals in the outer pocket so not much pressure was even put on the zipper, & yet the zipper just separated. This is not a self-repairing zipper either. Wondering if this is a knockoff? Bag is a different color of blue than seen in stores & in the photos online here. This bag is a navy blue - not the medium blue as seen in these photos. Don’t waste your money!
customer_reviews.author: phe568

customer_reviews.title: Zipper did not last even 2 x times
customer_reviews.text: got the bag on 31 oct 17 for a trip... maxlite 4 26 exp rllbrd blu #401152602 -first attempt to pack and close the zipper, the teeth broken open, and couldnt use for the trip... we departed and now find out we missed our return product date... with amazon... anyway... poor product workmanship in my opinion. my wife's bag same type but with four wheels, maxlite 4 worked fine till we were on the trip... her zipper got stuck and was very hard to get to work... but it held together... on the trip...
customer_reviews.author: Gloria Jeanne Ingersoll

customer_reviews.title: Light weight and easy to maneuver
customer_reviews.text: We bought this to replace a 2008 Skyway piece that baggage handlers recently trashed and broke the frame. We need the new light weight standard and spinner style as we are older and cannot haul the 2-wheel bags as freely. I have a little red TravelPro carry-on that I love and can manage it easily. This looks to be a perfect bag for check-in luggage for a week. It seems a bit flimsy in the sides, so our 2019 trips will tell if it holds up to the gorillas in airline baggage!
customer_reviews.author: GJ Simmons

customer_reviews.title: Great suitcase
customer_reviews.text: I haven't bought luggage in 10 years, so this was a huge improvement from my old Delsy suitcase. It is light and spacious. That combination is important when you are working to minimize bag fees while traveling. I packed 5 days of clothes and other travel supplies for 4 people in this thing and it still was under the weight limit. The purple makes it stand out most of the time. Except when someone at the airport walks by with the same suitcase.....
customer_reviews.author: Laura R

customer_reviews.title: I wish they made a 23" in the same product line.
customer_reviews.text: I have the 21" version of this as well. they're both well-made and seem quite sturdy. The wheels work great and the roll with very little effort. I use the 21" version for two-nighters, but I sometimes have three- and four-nighters, so I pull this out. It is HUGE compared to the 21" model. If I could buy this in 23", I'd use a single suitcase for all my trips. Recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Zube

customer_reviews.title: Bad zipper on an otherwise nice carry-on
customer_reviews.text: I own a TravelPro carry-on, similar to this one but bought years ago. That old one has given me years of good service. Decided to get a second one. This current model has very inferior zippers for the main compartment. The zipper consistently gets stuck around the corners and is difficult and frustrating to deal with. I'm returning the suitcase, which is a shame because otherwise it's quite nice. Disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Book Collector

customer_reviews.title: Great, light weight suit case
customer_reviews.text: Purchased 3 of these bags for my family and they are very nice. The wheels do well in most cases, though thicker carpet gives them some problems. They are very light and spacious. I was easily able to get enough clothes for an 8 day cruise in one. I was considering the larger size, but am glad I went smaller. I have concerns with the curved shape of the zippers on the front porch. It presses on the zipper and one arrived damaged from where this happened. The company was quick to replace it so the customer service was good. Overall I would definitely recommend them for the price.
customer_reviews.author: C. Marois

customer_reviews.title: Broke on first use
customer_reviews.text: Bought this due to good reviews, but disappointed in performance. On the first trip which was international and numerous flights the telescoping handle would not raise. Returning it.
customer_reviews.author: JDillon

customer_reviews.title: While I love this suitcase it is huge
customer_reviews.text: While I love this suitcase it is huge. You will go over the airline weight limit if you fill this thing up. It holds a lot of cloths.
customer_reviews.author: Jacob Baggett

customer_reviews.title: My Samsonite is holding up just fine and holds more
customer_reviews.text: One, it holds less than my Samsonite of the same dimensions. Second, we've used it twice cross country as a carry on. The piping is coming off, which is not a big deal, but the zippers are breaking. My son uses it and does not overpack it and still it is failing. My Samsonite is holding up just fine and holds more, AND has been on one more trip than this one has. I'd pay the extra bit for a Samsonite.
customer_reviews.author: Kt. Orlopp

customer_reviews.title: Smaller than you think
customer_reviews.text: Underwhelmingly small. The measurements provided are misleading. Yes, the bag is technically 23" tall but they must be including the very, very tip of the soft handle to the very bottom of the wheels. Meanwhile, the wheels and whole bottom foundation of the bag seem to take up a solid 3" of that. Listing the inside as 20" tall also is extremely generous. Even pushing their fabric back I can only get slightly above 19". Seems nit-picky, but when you're looking for a carry-on bag of a particular size, an inch here and there makes a huge difference. This bag just feels very small for the measurements.
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie Glazer

customer_reviews.title: Glides Like a Dream
customer_reviews.text: It's been ten years since I bought a large piece of luggage, but but my old suitcase finally broke. How they've improved! This piece was so lightweight and moves so easily, my husband wants to upgrade his, too. With airlines weighing every pound, it makes sense to go for lighter luggage to keep from paying overweight fees. I love the spinner wheels, the tapered profile which means this suitcase won't fall over if improperly packed, and the overall quality. I was surprised the zippers didn't operate very smoothly; that docks a star from my review.
customer_reviews.author: bojojoti

customer_reviews.title: Wheels worked great. Fit in overhead on US segment of flight ...
customer_reviews.text: Used for recent trip to Ireland. Wheels worked great. Fit in overhead on US segment of flight but had to turn sideways on smaller European flight. Holds less than my two wheeled bag but was much easier to maneuver. We travel by planes, trains and automobiles between cities and countries and it was great for walking along cobbled streets and sidewalks. A friend had a two wheeler and we kept having to stop because her's was flipping over and getting stuck.
customer_reviews.author: Bonnie Warren

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight, but not sturdy
customer_reviews.text: These are good suitcases, and certainly light weight. But that comes at the sacrifice of sturdiness. Aside from the base, where the wheels attach, there seems to be only a thin sheet of plastic to create the structure of this luggage. It crushes easily under the weight it is almost sure to encounter on top of it in the cargo hold -- particularly if it is not completely filled. This happened to ours on its first use, and it has been somewhat misshapen ever since.
customer_reviews.author: Bob

customer_reviews.title: Just What I'd Been Looking For
customer_reviews.text: Almost perfect. We travel out of a non-hub city so always have to make a connection. I'd been looking for a carry on suitcase that can be stowed under a seat, especially in smaller planes. It fit two out of three times on my last trip and the third time went in the overhead with no trouble. There is a zippered compartment for my laptop (13 inch), a smaller pocket for receipts or very small items and of course the larger compartment. I use that for my camera and other items that cannot be subjected to unknown rough handling. Nice.
customer_reviews.author: Claire Lea

customer_reviews.title: works well, questionable quality
customer_reviews.text: I bought this suitcase in November 2017. It is now September 2018. I've used it on 4 plane trips. I like the size and shape of this carry-on. I also like the pockets - they work well for the things I carry on. I am disappointed in the quality of this suitcase. The decoration came off the first time I used it. I don't think I was too rough on it - I didn't pull on it and I am not aware that it caught on anything. Photo attached
customer_reviews.author: Crager

customer_reviews.title: Great build quality, perfect size, just enough pockets.
customer_reviews.text: I’ve only used this a couple of times, but so far so good. Appears to be well built and should outlast the suitcase I got from one of those department stores. The pockets are just the right size and there’s enough of them to pack for trips. It’s a bit smaller than my previous suitcase, but a friend of mine who has the same one said you can expand the case and it’ll still fit in the overheads as a carry on. The expanded space gives you enough room to pack for an efficiently planned week long business trip. That’s a big plus to avoid the lines for checked baggage.
customer_reviews.author: Brent T Henning

customer_reviews.title: UNITED AIRLINES SCARED THE CRAP OUT OF ME
customer_reviews.text: I don't travel much but I bought this suitcase. I read luggage has to have a max of 62" and read other reviews saying with the wheels it is 64". So to be safe I called United Airlines and after explaining my concerns I was told it would be over-size and I would have to pay an additional $200 instead of $30. I can't believe this and am really upset. I love the suitcase and Travelpro has stated most airline accept it. I would hate to have to pay $200 - so I am wondering if anyone has run into this? Not sure why Travelpro made it total 64" though.
customer_reviews.author: DDLB

customer_reviews.title: Excedes Expectations
customer_reviews.text: I expected a durable, well made suitcase. Instead I found it to be that and more. The reinforced plastic cradle will support the load and ease the strain on seams and material. The handle is comfortable and easy to free up and use. It also appears to be sturdy enough with the internal frame to withstand many a rough rolling transit.
customer_reviews.author: ibdave

customer_reviews.title: Another Travelpro spinner for the win!
customer_reviews.text: I bought two Travelpro Maxlite 3 28 inch spinners almost 4 years ago and even after years of countless flights, heavy use and overpacking they still roll like butter and look great. So, when it needed to get a carry-on size suitcase I kept coming back to Travelpro and don't regret my purchase a bit. Flew with it last weekend and was easily able to roll it down the aisle of the plane and fit it into overhead bins. My only disappointment is that the wheels on the 21 inch spinner do not seem to roll as easily on carpet as my 28 inch spinners, however they still work well and I didn't have any difficulties.
customer_reviews.author: KMBK

customer_reviews.title: size of small steamer trunk -- read dimensions before ording
customer_reviews.text: I have a similar two-wheeled version of this 29" bag from the Maxlight series and the one I own is much smaller---- this 4 wheeler is deeper/wider and is simply HUGE. Construction is 5 star, thing rolls very easily but.. i can't imagine filling this w/ anything but silk and not going way (WAY) over typical 50lb luggage constraints. Other reviewers have made similar comments and I thought they were exaggerating--- please measure and if you want a HUGE bag this thing will not dissapoint
customer_reviews.author: C

customer_reviews.title: Bad quality
customer_reviews.text: In less than 1 month of use, the zipper broke.
customer_reviews.author: tatiana

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Excellent; supper light weight; wheels glides smoothly; taken on multiple international and domestic trips, and still looks like new.
customer_reviews.author: A. S.

customer_reviews.title: Great size!
customer_reviews.text: I cannot believe how light this suitcase is. I was going back and forth between ordering the 29 or the 25" - I'm glad I chose the 25". As a reference, my carryon (21") holds about 50 liters. This holds 92, so it is nearly double the size of a normal carry on suitcase.
customer_reviews.author: Lexi A. Witt

customer_reviews.title: Size not standard
customer_reviews.text: Ordered 2 exactly the same size. Received one much smaller for the same price. Return shipping is not free
customer_reviews.author: Smurfy

customer_reviews.title: Light and Just Right
customer_reviews.text: Lightweight, but plenty big enough to carry several days worth of clothing. I will be taking this on vacation soon, and am sure it will work perfectly for me. I love the spinner type wheels...have been wanting one of these bags for a long time. The other type of carry-ons are so difficult to maneuver.
customer_reviews.author: Highspirits1964

customer_reviews.title: Love the Spinners
customer_reviews.text: Love the Spinners! But be aware that because it has Spinner wheels, the space available inside of the luggage isn't as large as the same sized non-spinner wheelaboard bag. But it's worth it just to have the wheels spin as needed, especially when pulling another wheeled bag at the same time. It's well made and surprising, you can get a lot of stuff in this bag! (I try to roll most of my clothing as I find it keeps my clothes from getting too wrinkled, and takes up less space in the suitcase)
customer_reviews.author: LDSS

customer_reviews.title: Very lite and durable, was able to pack even ...
customer_reviews.text: Very lite and durable, was able to pack even more and still under weight limit. We will be ordering the larger size soon!
customer_reviews.author: Mary Holmes

customer_reviews.title: Needed a good carry on
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for the purpose of traveling light, while also making sure that my belongings would be safe. I've only taken it on one trip so far within the states and it worked well as a carry on and was easy to maneuver. I give it only four stars because after just one trip it looks like it will only make a few more trips before I'm going to have to get a new one, which is unfortunate because it wasn't handled rough or thrown around or anything that would cause it damage.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda Marie

customer_reviews.title: Arthritic R2D2
customer_reviews.text: The positives: It looks stylish, and the color stood out. The negatives: The wheels wouldn't track properly. I felt as if I was herding an arthritic R2D2 through the airport. The handle won't stay up at full height, so it collapsed frequently. The zippers stick. And it really took a couple of guys pounding it into the baggage measure thing to get it approved. When I was in the plane, it was very difficult to get it into the overhead compartment. And it was NOT overpacked. Keep looking.
customer_reviews.author: Cheryl.Whitehead

customer_reviews.title: ... this bag for the first time recently and I liked it. It was plenty big for the five ...
customer_reviews.text: Used this bag for the first time recently and I liked it . It was plenty big for the five days worth of clothes, two pair of tennis shoes and toiletry bag inside. The rollers were smooth and made it easy to pull or push along the side of me. Not too heavy to lift in and out of the car truck either. Good quality. I don't travel that often so it should last a lot of years
customer_reviews.author: Karl  D

customer_reviews.title: Great travel bag!
customer_reviews.text: Have been using it for months! Great bag, very durable, good for traveling. Fits in just about every compartment on board a plane. I fly often so I’ve had the opportunity to try it on regional airlines to the big airlines. It’s a great bag for anyone looking for a good bag with a reasonable price. Way better than the Walmart stuff I bought years ago. Mind you, it does have some battle scares but that’s only cause after a while of dragging it with me on board I’ve checked it in multiple times. So far it has survived being on the bottom too.
customer_reviews.author: Johnathon

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for our trip
customer_reviews.text: We bought two for our spring '19 trip to Italy. Great price for this brand. I like the style. I was able to pack everything I needed for 16 days. I like its light weight and maneuverability. The handle worked flawlessly as did the spinners, which is what I like so much about this brand. My only issue is that somehow during baggage handling one of the main zipper handles broke off. I was able to put one of those key rings through the handle opening and it now works fine.
customer_reviews.author: TGower

customer_reviews.title: Love the spinner wheels
customer_reviews.text: My first spinner and my 3rd travel pro bag. This is my favorite. I have the smaller and older version that can fit under your seat (19in) or in any overhead bin but needed more space for a 2week trip. This held everything and I loved the wheels because it is so much easier than dragging the suitcase. It hold a lot and the 2 pockets help to keep things organized. When it is fully stuffed and you can barely zip it, it is harder to get in the overhead bin so try not to do that.
customer_reviews.author: Philter

customer_reviews.title: Excellent for a 14-day trip to China
customer_reviews.text: You will have ample room for all your clothes for two weeks and will never worry about not having enough space on the return trip. At the same time, it was easy to move and put it up for screening (as required for train trips as well), even for me, a senior with heart damage but who doesn't use the wheelchairs. For many others who would rather not wait at baggage claim but prefer stowing bulky bags on overhead bins, just know that waits at baggage claims are never a factor in China. Forget getting stressed holding a Group 4 boarding card, and start enjoying the luxury of having a suitcase of the right size!
customer_reviews.author: Long and Short

customer_reviews.title: poor zipper
customer_reviews.text: I bought this suitcase last week and used it on one trip. It IS light and maneuverable. However, the main zipper is very poor quality. I can barely pull the zipper around the corners of the case. I sent it back today to exchange it because I am afraid it will not last on my next trip. My sister bought the same suitcase, same color, same size, a few months ago and the zipper on hers is fine. So it may be a quality control problem. I have had many TravelPro suitcases before and never had this problem.
customer_reviews.author: Yankee in the South

customer_reviews.title: Great quality, LARGE
customer_reviews.text: I should have paid closer attention to the dimensions. I already owned the matching carry-on suitcase, and purchased this for a matching set. I had assumed it would be the size of a standard checked, rolling suitcase, however, it is much bigger. At 5'2" tall, I could fit inside the suitcase. While it is larger than I wanted, the quality is great. I used it for my holiday traveling, and it has plenty of room. Be careful not to fill it all the way, to weigh more than the allotted weight by airlines. Mine was about 70% full of clothes, two pairs of shoes, and accessories and weighed in at 49 pounds at the airport.
customer_reviews.author: Cassie Murphy

customer_reviews.title: Zipper broke before I even left the house
customer_reviews.text: Color and fabric fine - BUT zipper hardware is cheap and fragile. After packing this for it's first use, I went to zip up the main compartment, and one of the pulls was missing . . . apparently snapped off while I was just filling the bag. Found it in a corner of the couch. I was able to wire the lock shut for travel, but will not use this bag again. Worried about it popping open on the whole trip. Too much trouble to box up and send back. Will replace with another brand of luggage. Absolutely cannot recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Cberes

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy, Reliable, Roomy
customer_reviews.text: This luggage exceeded my expectations. The performance, build quality, and stowability of this product is superb. The wheels roll incredibly smooth and have zero wobble or shake. I was able to fit 2 weeks worth of clothing in this product for a business trip and still had some room to spare. I would not hesitate to purchase this or any of Travelpro's other various products again. I highly recommend this item.
customer_reviews.author: Z.P.

customer_reviews.title: I want the whole set now!
customer_reviews.text: I love everything about this suitcase. No negatives. Travelled from the US to many cities in Australia for 17 days, and the suitcase held up beautifully. The suitcase will be coming with me to Italy in a few months. Very pleased with this purchase. If you’re on the fence, buy it!
customer_reviews.author: Marian L

customer_reviews.title: Sized for international carry-on
customer_reviews.text: From my measurements, this one WILL pass the new international size requirements for carry-on, and it's very lightweight, so I should be able to lift it up to the overhead bin. Seems small, but I am devoted to the idea of carry-on! This will force me to lighten up on my packing. Construction looks very good.
customer_reviews.author: Lyte

customer_reviews.title: Very lightweight, 4 spinners roll with ease.  Great price, great bag.
customer_reviews.text: Used this as my only luggage on a 5 day trip staying in different hotel each night. Very lightweight, easy for me to lift into car with one hand. My first piece with 4 spinners - what a difference! No more arm strain from pulling it behind Me. Used the outside pocket for tablet, newspaper, and other things I was going to need on the flight/car trips, so it was easy to pull them out before stowing it in trunk/overhead bin.
customer_reviews.author: Diggerduck

customer_reviews.title: Didn't last long
customer_reviews.text: After 1 trip the zipper pull fell off of the main compartment. Kind of a bummer because now I have to call the manufacturer etc etc because the zipper pull, while small, is almost as important as the wheels. I will update this review if Travelon gives me any problem with sending a new pull.
customer_reviews.author: cindycpa

customer_reviews.title: I like it but haven't used it.
customer_reviews.text: I had a rockland from amazon. Lasted less than a year. The warranty made me ship it back at my expense and pay them $40 to boot. So it's in the trash and I learned a lesson. Spend a bit more for a better piece of luggage. Looked at this warranty, and it says send it back and they will make it good. Figure UPS will charge me $20 but maybe it will never happen. Looks very well built.
customer_reviews.author: J. Barker

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight,4  swivel wheels and most times is carry-on.
customer_reviews.text: I'm a retired woman and I love my TravelPro. Handles my packing needs well. Most of my trips are 3-6 days. I pack lightly for my clothing, but my other stuff adds up. I pack 1-2 sets of shoes, slippers, modest nightgown and robe. An extra large ziplock bag for hair stuff, medium plastic bag of toiletries, small or snack size each for fingernail stuff and cotton balls & swabs. 1 travel hairdryer. This all fits with the clothing in this suitcase perfectly. Between TravelPro and Ziplock, I'm a happy traveler.
customer_reviews.author: Ironjawed_woman

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy
customer_reviews.text: Here's my review after about one year of use --> Very well- made. Sturdy. Nice color. Wheels have stayed strong, unlike other models I've purchased in the past. I would definitely purchase again if needed.
customer_reviews.author: J. Maks

customer_reviews.title: " not super heavy duty
customer_reviews.text: For the price, it is okay. It is very lightweight, which probably compromises its sturdiness. The overall construction, and even the zippers are "fair to midland," not super heavy duty." I will probably use my Travelpro as a carry-on, packing it with lightweight items, and will use by Eddie Bauer (which is considerably sturdier, albeit much more expensive than Travelpro) as "checked" luggage. For those of you who are deciding on a color, i bought the purple; it is gorgeous!
customer_reviews.author: Nancy  Weber

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality!!!
customer_reviews.text: Top screw on handle broke. Zipper broke on first use
customer_reviews.author: cast iron addict

customer_reviews.title: Love it so far
customer_reviews.text: Very light. Love it so far. The only thing keeping it from 5 stars is the loss of space on the inside for the structure. Part of it sticks out into the luggage area and takes away from precious packing space. I'm not sure how to avoid that and still keep the outside size that fits airline specs for carryon, but it doesn't hold as much as other carry-ons I've purchased. Overall, though, I do like the bag, I just have to plan differently on what I carry on.
customer_reviews.author: Kim's Kindle

customer_reviews.title: It takes the abuse I give it.
customer_reviews.text: Nice and light weight. Like the spinning four wheels. Replaced a 2-wheel travel pro that I used (and kind of abused) for a good 10 years. This one doesn't seem quite as sturdy, but after 4 trips it is still holding up well. I think it is a good one. My one complaint is this - I am a normal-sized person (if normal is 6'4"). Anyway for my height I wish the hand was about 4" longer as that would make it easier to pull behind me. It is long enough to roll along side of me, though. All-in-all a good case for the $.
customer_reviews.author: W. Carlson

customer_reviews.title: Very Nice Bag
customer_reviews.text: Ordered as a gift for my hubby. SO glad I made it home before him because it arrives in a Travelpro box, not Amazon. Whew! Im happy with my purchase. This luggage is attractive, sturdy yet lightweight, and very well made including the pull out handle. Lots of room. There are 4 wheels and it rolls beautifully. It's really the perfect size and I can't wait until he sees it. Had an issue with shipping, which was NOT the shipper or Amazons fault. It got lost by USPS. I ordered a replacement and had it within 24 hours at no charge.
customer_reviews.author: FLA

customer_reviews.title: Overall dimensions are accurate.
customer_reviews.text: I was in the market for a new carry-on that conformed to international rather than domestic size requirements, and this case fits the bill. The only suggestion I have is to recommend carrying a strap with you if it is necessary to cinch the soft front of the case down to the required 9". Even with the front pocket empty, the thickness tends more toward 10", which may catch the eye of a vigilant Lufthansa flight attendant. But a strap around the outside of the case easily brings it into compliance.
customer_reviews.author: Susan B. Coffin

customer_reviews.title: Perfect!
customer_reviews.text: So glad I bought two of these 25' Maxlite spinners for our recent ski trip. They roll great, and expand nicely. They are so lightweight, which means that you can actually pack them full and likely not run into the 50 lb.weight limit. These did great so far on 2 flights. Definitely recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great purchase!
customer_reviews.text: I decided to order this Travelpro Maxlite 4 International Carry-On for a longer trip. Since I was going to a sunny and warm place I was able to pack 10 days worth of clothes into this suitcase. I was surprised by the amount that it holds and I'm very please with this purchase
customer_reviews.author: KaiKev

customer_reviews.title: Proper size but quality is suspect - handle broke after 11mo
customer_reviews.text: Carry-on was the proper size for all of my flights. However, the handle broke after about 11 months of use averaging 1-2 flights per month. The plastic snapped when I went to turn a corner, and the telescoping is messed up so there's no chance of repair. Pretty disappointed - I am currently shopping for new carry-on bag and will not be going with Travelpro.
customer_reviews.author: JC

customer_reviews.title: This is large bag.
customer_reviews.text: I don't have a complaint. I returned this suitcase because it is very large. I compared the 29 inch parameter to outside dimensions of suitcase I'm replacing. That was a mistake, this suitcase is at least 4 inches taller than my old one. So the 29 inch must be an inside dimension. I could never pack this bag full and be under the 50 pounds. I ordered the 25 inch version.
customer_reviews.author: KKid

customer_reviews.title: Frequent travelers MUST have brand
customer_reviews.text: I’m a frequent business traveler (100,000 k + international miles a year ) & out of several brands - Tumi, Briggs & Riley, etc I keep coming back to Travelpro for the design & durability. I appreciate the well thought out placement of pockets on the outside of the bag and wheels that keep up with my miles year after year. I bought this one to replace my old one - ONLY because I prefer the 4 wheels over 2. My 5 year old 2 wheel is still going Strong too !!
customer_reviews.author: Whereisj_fish

product_meta.title: Travelpro Maxlite 4-Softside Expandable Luggage with Spinner Wheels, Black, Carry-On 21-Inch
product_meta.description: Size:Carry-On 21-Inch| Color:BlackTravel ultra light and assured with Maxlite 4. This extensive collection features 11 singularly lightweight and durable Spinners and Rollaboards with the look and quality of much more expensive luggage. The 21 inch Expandable Spinner Features: Water repellent coating, inside and out. 360-degree Spinners roll effortlessly in any direction you want to move. Patented Contour Grip for more comfort. Telescoping handle adds length and strength Stops at 38 inch and extra-tall 42.5 inch. Protective crash-guard wheel housings. Honeycomb framing system integrated with bottom tray provides outstanding lightweight durability. Exterior ticket pocket on Carry-Ons. Low-profile carry handles. Tapered 2 inch expansion designed to enhance stability Full-size zippered lid compartment. Zippered side mesh pocket. Adjustable hold-down straps with Duraflex anti-break buckles.
feature_bullets: 360 degree spinners roll effortlessly in any direction you want to move. Low profile top and side carry handles along with bottom handle cup
Telescoping handle adds length and strength, stops at 38 inch and extra tall 42.5 inch. Polyester fabric with stain resistant coating
Patented contour grip for more comfort
Limited lifetime warranty ; This Carry On bag has been sizer bin tested to accommodate overhead bin space on most major US airlines. Fully expanded Carry On may not meet airline restrictions
Dimensions 9L x 14W x 21H inches and Overall Dimensions 23Hx 15Wx 9.5D inches

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.5 out of 5 stars1,387 ratings4.5 out of 5 stars
